I will always continue to vote against this type of report, stressing that parliamentary immunity is not a personal privilege of the Member, but a guarantee of the independence of Parliament, as an institution, and of its Members.

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. \u2012 Georg List has decided to file a defamation complaint against Ivan Jakovčić. The latter allegedly uttered disparaging remarks against him in an interview.  At the time of the events, Ivan Jakovčić was a Member of the European Parliament. However, the statements attributed to him relate to an issue dating back to a period prior to the beginning of his term of office.  For this reason, I have chosen to support, with a vote in favour, the Zwiefka report, which calls for the waiver of Ivan Jakovčić's parliamentary immunity.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. The statement in question by Ivan Jakovic relates to a matter which dates back to a time when he was not yet the holder of his office. Freedom of expression should be given, but this must not be a carte blanche for defamation or defamation. That is why I voted in favour of this motion.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. The request concerns the lifting of the parliamentary immunity of Ivan Jakov-i, a Croatian member of the ALDE. While governor of the province of Istria in Croatia he called a German businessman an "idiot" who complained about the administrative complications of opening a polo field. He is being prosecuted for "insult and defamation". Since Ivan Jakovia has not expressed any opposition to the lifting of his immunity, I am voting in for it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. \u2012 The defence of the independence of the Mandate of the European Parliament is the responsibility of the European Parliament and that independence cannot be called into question. In accordance with Article 8 Protocol on the Privileges and Immunities of the European Union, members of the European Parliament may not be sought, detained or persecuted for the opinions or votes cast in the performance of their duties. A lawyer for a private complainant has requested the waiver of Ivan Jakovčić's parliamentary immunity. The claim is related to an alleged defamation crime. This request concerns the criminal proceedings brought against Ivan Jakovčić, relating to defamatory statements made by him in an interview with Croatian radio hrt.  The statements in question do not have a direct link with the performance of the duties of a Member, nor do they constitute an opinion or vote cast in the performance of their duties as a member of the European Parliament within the meaning of Article 8 of Protocol No 7. I therefore voted in favour of withgoing your immunity.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: In writing. We are calling for the lifting of Mr. Jakov-i-i-'s parliamentary immunity for publicly calling a businessman an idiot who accused him of the slowness of his administrative action. Freedom of expression must remain the principle, and restrictions must be the exception. It also seems disproportionate to waive a parliamentarian's immunity for a benign statement.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report, as the relevant Parliamentary Committee assessed this whole process according to the regulation.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. I voted against this request to waive parliamentary immunity because it relates to facts related to freedom of expression.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted to approve the report on the request to lift Ivan Jakovčić's immunity in accordance with the decision adopted in the European Parliament's Committee on Legal Affairs.

name: Urmas PAET
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported ivan jakovčić's request for waiver of immunity because he is in a pending case in Croatia.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 Considering that the lawyer of a private applicant has requested the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of MEP Ivan Jakovčić in the context of proceedings concerning an alleged offence of defamation; that in a letter dated 14 February 2014 the Permanent Representative of the Republic of Croatia to the EU informed the President of the European Parliament that, in the absence of specific procedural rules on the waiver of the immunity of a Croatian Member of the European Parliament, the provisions governing requests for waiver of the immunity of a Member of the National Parliament should be applied and that, in accordance with those provisions, the request for the deliberation of pre-trial detention or for the criminal charges against a Member may be forwarded by any competent State body, by the party affected as a claimant or by a private applicant; For these reasons, I voted in favour.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. \u2012 In criminal proceedings pending before the Municipal Court of Pazin (Croatia), the lawyer of the injured party, as the applicant, transmitted to the European Parliament, on 5 September 2014, the request for waiver of the immunity of Ivan Jakovčić, in connection with a lawsuit in which he is accused of having made defamatory statements in an interview with Croatian Radio HRT , on 22 July 2014. According to the report of the Committee on Legal Affairs, Ivan Jakovčić was a Member of the European Parliament at the time of the interview, but the alleged statements relate to an issue dating back to a time when he was not yet in office. Therefore, the statements in question do not have a direct and clear link with the performance of the duties of a Member of the European Parliament, nor do they constitute an opinion or vote cast in the performance of their duties as a member of the European Parliament. In the opinion of that report, I voted in favour of this Decision which lifts ivan jakovčić's immunity.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the suspension of this Member's parliamentary immunity in view of the view that the accusations made against him in his country of origin relate to allegedly defamatory statements made when he was already a Member of the European Parliament but which have no direct or obvious relationship with the exercise of the functions of Member of Parliament.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the lifting of The immunity of Mr Ivan Jakov-i, so that the Croatian justice system could do its job, with strict respect for the rights of the defence, considering that the alleged offence has no direct or obvious connection to the performance of his duties as a Member of the European Parliament. The proceedings are not intended to harm the political career of the Member concerned, but concern defamatory remarks allegedly made in an interview with croatian broadcaster HRT while he was not yet acting as an MEP.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. \u2012 This report concerns a request for the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of Croatian MEP Ivan Jakovčić, requested by the lawyer of Georg List, an international businessman, who has lodged a criminal complaint against the current Member of the European Parliament for defamation in relation to offensive statements made in an interview given to Croatian radio. After a favourable opinion of the Committee on Legal Affairs concerning the admissibility of an application for waiver of immunity made by a natural person, as well as its applicability to the present case, I consider that the conditions for the waiver of parliamentary immunity are met, which is why I have given my vote in favour.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. The report calls for the suspension of the parliamentary immunity of Croatian ALDE MP Ivan Jakovcic. Since the same Member concerned is in favour of suspension, I voted in favour.

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in support of the request for waiver of the immunity of Ivan Jakovčić. The statement made by Mr Jakovčić does not have a direct and obvious connection with Mr Jakovčić’s performance of his duties as a Member of the European Parliament nor does it constitute an opinion expressed or a vote cast in the performance of his duties as a Member of the European Parliament for the purposes of Article 8 of Protocol No 7.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: Writing. \u2012 MEPs should be held to account in court when the need to investigate their activities is required, in accordance with existing legal procedures.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: in writing. – We voted in favour of this report. We understand that although Ivan Jakovcic was a Member of the EP at the time the facts took place, these facts are not related to his activity as an MEP, so there is no problem in the revocation of immunity.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: In writing. The Delegation of the National Front voted against the request to lift Mr Jakov-i-i's parliamentary immunity because we are simply defending freedom of expression.

name: Ernest URTASUN
text: in writing. I voted in favour of suspending the impunity of MEP Ivan Jokovcic as a common practice in these cases.

name: Ángela VALLINA
text: in writing. The report calls for the suspension of the parliamentary immunity of Croatian ALDE MP Ivan Jakovcic. Since the same Member concerned is in favour of suspension, I voted in favour.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. The case is related to a complaint filed against Ivan Jakovčić by businessman Georg List, an international businessman, who has been trying to build a polo field in the Motovun area (Croatia) since 2002. Despite major investments, the project has not yet been started due to the political and administrative obstacles that Georg List has allegedly faced and which have led him to blame local authorities in public, including making allegations about a potential bribery case. Georg List decided, following an interview, to lodge a complaint against Ivan Jakovčić for the allegedly defamatory nature of the statement in question. Ivan Jakovčić was a Member of the European Parliament at the time of the interview. However, the alleged statements relate to an issue dating back to a time when he had not yet held that office. We believe that this case needs a better assessment by Parliament's legal services.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. The statement in question by Ivan Jakovic relates to a matter which dates back to a time when he was not yet the holder of his office. Freedom of expression should be given, but this must not be a carte blanche for defamation or defamation. That is why I voted in favour of this motion.

name: Kristina WINBERG
text: in writing. ‒ We will support the requests for waiver of immunities as in these reports. We are in favour of legal equality, the principle under which all people are subject to the same laws of justice – the fact that everyone must be treated equally under the law.

name: Lars ADAKTUSSON
text: Written. Today we voted on financial contributions from the so-called Globalisation Fund to people who have become unemployed after the closure of European companies. I consistently vote against these unemployment benefits for two reasons: firstly, labour market policies and financial support for the unemployed should be decided on, and financed, at national level – not at European level. Secondly, the basic idea of the Fund is based on the fact that globalisation is something negative – which is not true. Globalisation and free trade lead to growth and peace.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the report as it allows the mobilisation following a total of 424 redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd (LTAI) and two of its suppliers in Ireland. This mobilisation of funds is due to the disastrous consequences of the internationalisation of productive sectors in the EU.  These funds are not able to solve the problems of these workers in the context of unemployment in Ireland, but at least give the possibility of alleviating a small part of human drama. That is why I have decided to vote in favour of this report.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: i scríbhinn. – Chaith mé vóta i bhfabhar na tuarascála seo de bharr go n-aithním go bhfuil an Ciste Eorpach um Choigeartú don Domhandú (CED) ábalta cabhair agus deiseanna a thabhairt dóibh siúd atá tar éis a bpost a chailliúint mar gheall ar an ngéarchéim eacnamaíochta. Is cás Éireannach é seo agus baineann sé le 250 iomarcaíocht ó Lufthansa Technik agus 200 duine óg atá dífhostaithe. Tá tionchar ollmhór ag dúnadh an chomhlachta seo ar an gceantar áitiúil i mBaile Átha Cliath, agus cinnte, níos faide ná sin fós. Bhí sé lonnaithe in áit atá faoi mhíbhuntáiste le leibhéal íseal de gnóthachtáil oideachasúil srl. Mar aon leis sin, tá scileanna faoi leith ag na daoine seo a chiallaíonn go mbeidh sé deacair dóibh post eile a aimsiú in earnáil dhifriúil.  Leis an aistriú airgid de EUR 2 490 758 áfach, beidh na daoine atá fágtha gan fostaíocht anois ábalta scileanna nua a fhoghlaim, rud a chiallaíonn go mbeidh sé níos fusa dóibh post eile a aimsiú in earnáil éagsúil.  De ghnáth bíonn 500 duine ar a laghad de dhíth chun iarratas a dhéanamh chuig CED, mar sin cuirim fáilte roimh an tslí gur cuireadh maolú i bhfeidhm ionas go mbeidh teacht ag na daoine ar an gciste seo.

name: Nikos ANDROULAKIS
text: S&D), in writing. \u2012 The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was created to provide additional support to workers suffering the effects of globalisation It is good that the Union has put in place legislative and budgetary instruments to provide additional support to workers and training to facilitate their reintegration into the labour market.  I believe that the Union's financial assistance to workers made redundant should be dynamic and made available as quickly and efficiently as possible. I am therefore voting in favour of the report approving Ireland's application EGF/2014/016 IE/Lufthansa Technik for the mobilisation of funds from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ The principle of subsidiarity dictates that decisions should be taken at the closest possible level to the citizen – in this case at regional or national level. Therefore, these projects should not be funded by the European Union. It is absurd that the arbiters of whether this funding should, or should not, be given are Members of the European Parliament with no detailed knowledge of the situation. This project may well be of benefit to the people of Ireland, but I am not best placed to judge. The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund should be scrapped, which would give money back to the Member States to decide for themselves about the appropriateness of such funding. Consequently, I had no option but to vote against – even though this may be a worthwhile project.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this proposal, which aims to mobilise the EGF for Greece's needs in order to support the reintegration of workers made redundant from Lufthansa Technik into the labour market. According to the Irish authorities, the closure of Lufthansa Technik was due to a significant change in the EU's trade in goods and services due to technological changes as it shifted to the production of the next generation of aircraft and components. The expansion of the production methods of aircraft components has affected the market laws on which lufthansa Technik's business model was based and the global aircraft production site has changed. The EGF is intended to provide a total amount of EUR 2 490 758 to 149 redundant workers. The package of services tailored to them will include guidance and counselling, skills assessment, retraining, vocational training, and advice on entrepreneurship.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. Although opposed to the hypocritical system of the "Globalization Adjustment Fund", I voted in favour of this aid to Lufthansa Technik employees.  Like most European industries, the 'repair/installation of machinery and equipment' sector, however important, is being hit hard by the extra-Community competition against which the European institutions refuse to protect us. In addition to the relocation of global aircraft production, airlines in Western Europe and the United States are increasingly likely to send their wide-body aircraft to China for heavy maintenance, and even parent company Lufthansa Technik has decided to entrust its global MRO operations for the Airbus A330/A340 to its subsidiary Lufthansa Technik Philippines (LTP). There is an urgent need to prevent these relocations, which are dramatically damaging the Member States of the European Union, which are seeing their factories close and their know-how disappear, in favour of competitors who often do not meet our standards.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: in writing. U2012 I support the mobilization of these funds for two reasons: they will affect a very difficult group to relocate for their specific skills and an average age that is close to the average retirement age in Ireland and by the inclusion of about 200 "ni-nis" who will have a powerful tool to join the labour market. It is an imaginative and practical use of the possibilities of globalization adaptation funds. To reflect, the cause of the layoffs: the relocation of the great maintenance of the largest aircraft from European companies to Asian countries. In this case the Philippines.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. This request relates to the provision of assistance to the aviation sector in Ireland following the dismissal of 424 employees which could lead to "serious repercussions on the employment and economy of the region".  Indeed, without public aid, these redundancies could have dramatic economic and social consequences on the region given the specific skills of the workers concerned. However, a special scheme is requested by the Committee on Budgets: aid will not be granted to all laid-off workers, but will be assessed on a case-by-case basis to ensure that the condition of "serious impact on the regional economy" is met.  It is a question of mobilizing 2,490,758 euros to help the reorientation and training, the creation of businesses... These layoffs are due to changes in the structures of the economy, caused by globalization and the relocation of aircraft production. Once again, this testifies to the hypocritical behaviour of the European Union, which deplores the consequences of the causes it cherishes, namely globalised and deregulated competition, and which finds, to repair them, only the obole to bring to the laid-off workers...  Considering that this aid is essential to repair the damage caused by globalization, I voted for it.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I supported, with my vote, the mobilisation of the EGF worth EUR 2 490 758 in favour of the 424 workers made redundant at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland and two of its suppliers due to relocation to Asia. The Globalisation Adjustment Fund is a key instrument for supporting the internal market, but this Europe should combat the malfunctioning of it; we must stop the uncontrolled relocation of large companies to Asia and China.

name: Malin BJÖRK
text: Written. I have voted in favour of this report. I therefore do so to provide workers in the cases in question with financial support for retraining and/or other measures to find new jobs. However, I would like to stress that the high level of unemployment in europe could be effectively combated if the austerity policies of the European Commission and the governments of the Member States have long been pursued could be stopped. Creating new jobs in Europe requires a new economic policy with massive public and environmentally friendly investments. Public investment is needed in schools, health and social care, but also in infrastructure, rail, public transport, energy-efficient housing and sustainable energy systems.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this report to approve the mobilisation of EUR 2 490 758 from the Globalisation Adjustment Fund for 424 workers who have lost their jobs at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd and two of its suppliers in Ireland engaged in the repair and installation of machinery and equipment. These layoffs have resulted from profound structural changes in the patterns of international trade caused by globalisation, as a result of a major transformation of EU trade in goods and services due to a technological change in the production of aircraft and next-generation components, from a reorientation towards practices of producing larger aircraft components , and a change in the location of global aircraft production; highlighting the tendency of U.S. and Western European airlines to ship their large-capacity aircraft to China for heavy maintenance. The customized services to be financed from the EGF include training and recycling activities that provide good assistance for the reintegration of the workers concerned.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because it supports the granting of financial support from the European Globalisation Fund to 149 workers made redundant by the Irish company Lufthansa Technik during the reporting period from 1 March to 30 June 2014. The Irish authorities argue that the closure of LTAI was due to a significant change in the EU's trade in goods and services due to technological changes as it shifted to the production of the next generation of aircraft and components. The extension of the production methods of aircraft components has affected the market laws on which the LTAI business model was based and the global production site of aircraft has changed. The coordinated package of services co-financed by individual needs includes guidance and career planning, EGF training grants, training and further education programmes, higher education programmes, support for enterprises and self-employed persons, financial support, including a scheme for EGF contributions to course.

name: Andrea BOCSKOR
text: Writing. \u2012 The request submitted by the Irish Government reflects the exceptional situation that the redundancy of Lufthansa Technik affecting 424 workers has a serious impact on the population of the area concerned, the situation of employment. I voted in favour of this request, but at the same time I would like to draw attention to the fact that the company concerned is operating on a global scale. Therefore, the Commission should monitor that, when relocating activities, neither Lufthansa Technik nor any other company in general should apply for job-creating aid from eu or other sources in another country.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: Writing. I also supported this decision to allocate the EGF in the amount of EUR 2 490 758 to support the redundancy workers at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland (LTAI) in Ireland.  The closure of LTAI is the result of major technological changes in the production of aircraft, which have also affected their maintenance. European and American airlines are sending their intercontinent flights to China for major maintenance work, leaving European aircraft maintenance workers out of work. In addition, even parent company Lufthansa Technik has decided to carry out maintenance work on certain types of aircraft in the company's exposure in the Philippines. As a result, there has been intense redundancy in the repair and assembly sector in the regions of southern and eastern Ireland, with extremely negative consequences for the whole area. Because of the specific skills and low level of education, it is difficult for laid-off workers to find new employment. The EGF will thus be allocated to 149 workers made redundant, receiving vocational counselling, further education, self-employment assistance, higher education, and 200 young people who are not in employment or not in education will receive the same measures.

name: Biljana BORZAN
text: Written. ‒Ireland applied for a financial contribution from the EGF following the redundancies of 424 lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd. workers and two of its suppliers in Ireland. The situation has a serious impact on employment in the region and the local and regional economy. As the Irish authorities, except for the 250 targeted beneficiaries, will provide needs-friendly services to be co-financed by the EGF for up to 200 young people who are not in employment, education or training and are under 25 on the date of submission of the application, I support this report.

name: Marie-Christine BOUTONNET
text: In writing. I voted for the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund. It helps workers who have been made redundant as a result of structural changes in the context of globalization. This request follows the dismissal of 424 people in Ireland and covers EUR 2,490,728, representing 60% of the total cost. The irish authorities' intervention in favour of employment in this context can be useful in alleosing the damage of globalisation.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. ‒ I voted yes since I agree with the decision to use the EGF to support the Irish redundant workers of Lufthansa that have lost their jobs.

name: Lynn BOYLAN
text: i scríbhinn. – Chaith mé vóta i bhfábhar an tuairisc seo de bharr go athnáim go bhfuil an Ciste Eorpach a Choigeartú don Domhandú ábalta cabhair agus deiseanna a thabhairt dóibh siúd a bhfuil tar éis a bpost a chailliúint mar gheall ar an géarchéim eacnamaíochta. Is cás Éireannach is seo agus baineann sé le 250 iomarcaíochtaí ó Lufthansa Technik agus 200 daoine ógá atá dífhostaithe. Tá tionchar ollmhór ag dúnadh an comhlacht seo air an gceantar áitiúil i mBaile Átha Cliath, agus cinnte, nios faide ná sin fós. Bhí sé lonnaithe in áit atá faoi mhíbuntáiste le leibhéal íseal de gnóthachtáil oideachasúil srl. Mar aon le sin, tá scileanna faoi leith ag na daoine seo a chiallaíonn go mbeidh sé deacar dóibh post eile a aimsiú in earnáil difriúil. Leis an aistriú airgead de EUR 2 490 758 áfach, beidh na daoine atá fágtha gan fostaíocht anois ábalta scileanna nua a fhoghlaim, rud a chiallaíonn go mbeidh sé níos fusa dóibh post eile a aimsiú in earnáil éagsúil. De ghnáth bíonn 500 daoine air a laghad de dhith chun iarratas a dhéanamh chuig an EGF, mar sin cuirim fáilte roimh an slí gur chuireadh maolú i bhfeidhm ionas go mbeidh teacht ag na daoine air an gciste seo.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: in writing. \u2012 Although globalisation is seen as a positive factor that has led to the integration and interdependence of markets, it has also had negative effects on the economy. One example is the Lufthansa Technik aircraft maintenance, repair and overhaul plant in Ireland, which has had to make redundancies due to changes in EU trade in goods and services. It has led to a change in aircraft component production practices, which has led to the change in the location of production worldwide, making it more cost-effective for Western European and US carriers to send aircraft to India or China for cheap labour. This was also done by Lufthansa, by concluding alliances with operators in China or the Philippines. The only beneficiary was the carrier, but the workers made redundant suffered. The dismissals had negative effects on eastern and southern Ireland. 424 people and 200 other young people who are not professionally integrated and do not follow any educational or training programmes can benefit from THE EGF aid of EUR 2 490 750.  I support the proposal because it is necessary to reintegrate workers who cannot find a job, bearing in mind that most of them have skills only in this area.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour. Relocation to Asian markets is causing irreparable damage and bringing unemployment and poverty to Europe. We must support the families of workers who are victims of globalisation.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted today in favour of the report on the proposal on the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (the EGF, set up to provide additional support to workers affected by major changes in the structure of world trade) which refers to ireland's request for redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland (LTAI). The Irish authorities claim that the change towards the production of new generation aircraft and components, the shift to larger-scale methods in the production of aircraft components and the geographical transfer of world aircraft production have had a negative impact on the business model on which LTAI relied, causing its closure.  Redundancies therefore appear to be linked to changes in the structure of world trade. I therefore voted in favour of this measure. I regret that Italian companies are not able to benefit more from the EGF because of the lack of support from local and national institutions that submitted only 14 requests in total between 2007 and 2014.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: i scríbhinn. – Chaith mé vóta i bhfabhar na tuarascála seo de bharr go n-aithním go bhfuil an Ciste Eorpach a Choigeartú don Domhandú (CED) ábalta cabhair agus deiseanna a thabhairt dóibh siúd atá tar éis a bpost a chailliúint mar gheall ar an ngéarchéim eacnamaíochta. Is cás Éireannach is seo agus baineann sé le 250 iomarcaíocht ó Lufthansa Technik agus 200 duine óg atá dífhostaithe. Tá tionchar ollmhór ag dúnadh an chomhlachta seo air an gceantar áitiúil i mBaile Átha Cliath, agus cinnte, nios faide ná sin fós. Bhí sé lonnaithe in áit atá faoi mhíbhuntáiste le leibhéal íseal de gnóthachtáil oideachasúil srl. Mar aon leis sin, tá scileanna faoi leith ag na daoine seo a chiallaíonn go mbeidh sé deacair dóibh post eile a aimsiú in earnáil dhifriúil.  Leis an aistriú airgid de EUR 2 490 758 áfach, beidh na daoine atá fágtha gan fostaíocht anois ábalta scileanna nua a fhoghlaim, rud a chiallaíonn go mbeidh sé níos fusa dóibh post eile a aimsiú in earnáil éagsúil.  De ghnáth bíonn 500 duine air a laghad de dhíth chun iarratas a dhéanamh chuig CED, mar sin cuirim fáilte roimh an tslí gur cuireadh maolú i bhfeidhm ionas go mbeidh teacht ag na daoine air an gciste seo.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 The mobilisation of the Fund was requested following 424 redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd (LTAI) and two of its suppliers in Ireland.  Redundancies are expected to have a strongly negative impact on the Southern and Eastern region, which has important pockets of local disadvantage. The region is characterised by a low level of education, a lack of professional qualifications and high levels of public housing.  The workers employed in the sector have very specific skills which are difficult to exploit in other sectors, which makes repositioning even more difficult. Intervention measures will therefore be concentrated particularly insistently on vocational guidance and career planning.

name: Aymeric CHAUPRADE
text: In writing. I supported this report on the mobilization of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund in favour of Lufthansa Technik. The south-eastern region of Ireland, like many other parts of the European Union, is hit hard by the crisis in the "repair and installation of machinery and equipment" sector, which is undergoing massive relocations of global aircraft production, particularly to China. The Company, based in Ireland, made 424 redundancies. Unfortunately, the EGF will only be able to benefit 250 sacked employees, but I welcome the decision of the Irish authorities to provide personalised services co-financed by the EGF to up to 200 young people under the age of 25 who are unemployed, out of school or without training (NEET). As a patriot opposing relocations leading to the dismantling of our European industries and then our European know-how, I could only support this allocation of the EGF to Lufthansa Technik.

name: Caterina CHINNICI
text: in writing. \u2012 The effects on unemployment in recent years are not only linked to the economic and financial crisis, to which most job losses are certainly charged, but also to the consequences of globalisation. This is the case with the Irish headquarters of Lufthansa Technik Airmotive, which has been affected by the change in the market for aircraft and aircraft production and in the production of new generation components.  In order for Europe to remain competitive, and above all to maintain production within the Union, we need to rethink not only European industrial policy but also the overall strategy, so that our companies can remain competitive on the international stage. I therefore voted in favour of Ireland's request to the European Commission, which was also welcomed by the Council's Budget Committee, to mobilise EUR 2 490 758.

name: Salvatore CICU
text: in writing. \u2012 The measure we have examined includes the Commission's proposal to consider Lufthansa Technik's application to use the mobilisation of the EGF to support the occupational reintegration of redundant workers. The request amounts to EUR 2 490 758 for the Irish State, and provides for the redundancy of at least 500 workers over a four-month reference period.  It should be remembered that the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional support to workers affected by major changes in the structure of world trade. The Irish State considers that the closure of LTAI is the result of a major change in trade in EU goods and services, due to a technological migration to the production of new generation aircraft and components, the switch to large-scale methods in the production of aircraft components, with consequent repercussions on the market of the business model on which LTAI was based. , and finally to the geographical transfer of world aircraft production. For these reasons, I have chosen to vote in favour of this measure.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of mobilising the EGF in favour of Ireland because I believe that this Fund is useful for overcoming the period of adjustment following the structural changes in world trade due to globalisation. I believe that the 149 redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd (LTAI) in the 'repair and installation of machinery and equipment' in the Southern and Eastern region of Ireland are linked to these changes, as demonstrated by the tendency of US and Western European carriers to send their wide-body aircraft to China for heavy maintenance and by the fact that even parent company Lufthansa Technik has decided to base its global MRO operations for the Airbus A330/340 at its subsidiary Lufthansa Technik Philippines.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. \u2012 Mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF/2014/016 IE/Lufthansa Technik application) Report: Victor Negrescu (A8-0052/2015) The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was established in 2006 to provide additional assistance to workers affected by the consequences of major changes in the structure of international trade and to help reintegrate into the labour market. From 1 May 2009, the scope of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund has been extended to include support for workers made redundant as a direct result of the economic, financial and social crisis. At a time when Europe is in the face of a financial, economic and social crisis, with unemployment being one of the main consequences, the European Union should use all means at its service to react, in particular, to the support to be provided to people who have been left without a job. I therefore supported this report on the mobilisation of EUR 2 490 758 for Ireland, with the aim of supporting the 424 workers made redundant in Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd (LTAI) and two of its suppliers in Ireland.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the application to mobilise the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund EGF/2014/016 IE/Lufthansa Technik for the following reasons. The application concerns 424 Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd workers who have become redundant as a result of the economic crisis. The Irish authorities will provide a series of tailored education or training services co-financed by the EGF for up to 200 unemployed young people under the age of 25 at the time of application.   These redundancies, since the skills of workers working in this sector are very specific and not otherwise exploitable, will have a negative impact in the east and south of Ireland, both from a microeconomic point of view and in terms of vocational qualifications, which is currently experiencing a difficult situation.  In conclusion, there seem to be all the requirements for access to the Fund which, in the present case, result in job losses as a result of the economic crisis and considerable economic damage to the regional economy.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ The redundancies of 424 workers working in the ‘repair and installation of machinery and equipment’ sector are linked to major structural changes in world trade patterns due to globalisation. Personalised services for the redundant workers to be co-funded by EGF measures include guidance and career planning, training and provision of further educational programmes, due to the very specific skills of the workers, along with enterprise and self-employment support. I have therefore voted in favour of this report to support the reintegration workers into the labour market.

name: Ignazio CORRAO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of granting EGF funds to Ireland because by allocating these sums it is possible to safeguard workers made redundant by Lufthansa Technik and two of its suppliers. In addition, this appropriation should facilitate job search for 200 unemployed young people in the area. I believe that the granting of these funds cannot be the instrument that can best help workers, but in the absence of viable alternatives it must be supported.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the report as it allows the mobilisation following a total of 424 redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd (LTAI) and two of its suppliers in Ireland. This mobilisation of funds is due to the disastrous consequences of the internationalisation of productive sectors in the EU.  These funds are not able to solve the problems of these workers in the context of unemployment in Ireland, but at least give the possibility of alleviating a small part of human drama. That is why I have decided to vote in favour of this report.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ This application refers to the mobilisation of a total amount of EUR 2 490 758 from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for Ireland. It concerns 149 redundancies in the reference period from 1 March 2014 to 30 June 2014. According to the Irish authorities, the measures initiated on 7 December 2013 combine to form a coordinated package of personalised services and represent active labour market measures with the aim of reintegrating the workers into the labour market. As this action will provide a second chance to workers who have been affected directly by market changes due to globalisation, I voted in favour of the application.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: In writing. Following the dismissal of 424 employees at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd and two of its suppliers in the aircraft repair sector, Ireland has asked the European Union to mobilise the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EMF) to support people who have lost their jobs and to help them find work or start their own businesses. The aid granted is EUR 2,490,758 and covers 60% of the cost of the projects that will be offered to these employees. Given that Greece's request meets the EGF's mobilization criteria, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. In the face of the serious impact on local and regional employment and economy generated by redundancies in the aircraft repair sector in Ireland, the European Parliament has supported the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EMF). The aircraft repair sector in Ireland has suffered from technological shifts towards the production of next-generation aircraft and components and a change in the production practices of aircraft components on the global market. I have supported the reintegration of these laid-off workers, whose retraining seems difficult given the specificity of their skills.

name: Isabella DE MONTE
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional support to workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade. I supported the proposal to mobilise the EGF in favour of Ireland, because it will allow the reintegration into the labour market of 149 workers made redundant at Technik Airmotive Ireland, who have lost their jobs as a result of the major changes in world trade due to globalisation.

name: Andor DELI
text: Writing. \u2012 On 6 February 2015, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to use the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for Ireland. It was intended to support the reintegration into the labour market of workers made redundant as a result of changes in world trade, as a result of globalisation. The request was sent to the Commission on 19 September 2014, which concluded that the application fulfils the necessary conditions. The Irish authorities argue that the wave of redundancies at LTAI is primarily the result of major changes in the EU's trade in goods and services, which in turn is the result of a technological turnaround towards the production of next-generation aircraft and components; the change in the practice of the wider production of aircraft parts, together with its impact on the fundamental market factors of the business model on which ltai is based, and the change in the location of global aircraft production. A coordinated package of personalised services to be financed includes career guidance and career planning, EGF training support, training and further education programmes, higher education programmes, business/self-employment grants and income support, including the EGF course contribution scheme. In line with the position of the Fidesz-KDNP delegation, I believe that it is very important to support the motion. It is essential that workers made redundant are re-employed and receive adequate support.

name: Gérard DEPREZ
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this EGF contribution following 424 redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd in Ireland. The contribution is intended for 250 beneficiaries made redundant following the closure of LTAI as a result of a combination of factors: technological developments in the production of new generation aircraft and components and the relocation of global aircraft production. Manufacturers now tend to send their wide-body aircraft to China for heavy maintenance work. This situation has a serious impact on employment and the local economy, especially as the Southern and Eastern Ireland region is home to an already very disadvantaged population: low levels of education, lack of professional qualifications, high level of social housing. Further layoffs in companies in this sector in recent years have made it even more difficult for workers with specific skills that are difficult to exploit in other sectors.  That is why I thought it was important to support the EGF's call for mobilization, in order to enable those made redundant to benefit from European back-to-work aid: training, assistance in setting up companies or self-employed and income support.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 I voted against the report as I believe that the money from the Adjustment Fund should be given primarily to the dismissed and not to retraining companies producing skilled unemployed people.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: Writing. \u2012 On 6 February 2015, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to use the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for Ireland to support the reintegration into the labour market of workers made redundant as a result of major structural changes in world trade. The request was sent to the Commission on 19 September 2014. The Commission concludes that the request exhausts the necessary exceptional circumstances. The Irish authorities argue that the wave of redundancies at LTAI is primarily the result of major changes in the EU's trade in goods and services, which in turn is the result of a technological turnaround towards the production of next-generation aircraft and components; the change in the practice of the wider production of aircraft parts is a consequence of the change in the location of global aircraft production, together with the impact on the fundamental market factors of the business model on which ltai is based. A coordinated package of personalised services to be financed includes career guidance and career planning, EGF training support, training and further education programmes, higher education programmes, business/self-employment grants and income support, including the EGF course contribution scheme. The Fidesz-KDNP delegation supports the motion in the spirit of solidarity. It is important that redundant workers are adequately supported to re-enter the labour market.

name: Jill EVANS
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional assistance to workers who have lost their jobs as a result of major structural changes in world trade patterns. I voted in favour of this report because it is a means by which the EU can give valuable help to local economies hard hit by company closures. I regret that the government has not taken advantage of this fund in Wales.

name: José Inácio FARIA
text: in writing. The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund is an instrument that supports workers suffering the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns and aims to assist redundant workers. In the case of Lufthansa Technik, redundancies in the 'repair, maintenance and installation of machinery and equipment' in the southern and eastern regions of Ireland are linked to major structural changes in world trade patterns due to globalisation, which have led to the global relocation of aircraft production. Whereas the application meets the eligibility criteria laid down in the EGF Regulation, the aid package which I voted in favour of consists of vocational guidance and planning measures, EGF training grants, training and second-cycle education programmes, higher education programmes, business support and self-employment, as well as income support, including the EGF scheme for training expenditure contributions. This support should be complementary to the company's responsibility under national law and not to be overtaken by other types of financial support by the Union. This support relates to 424 redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd and two of its suppliers in Ireland.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 The EGF was created to provide additional support for workers made redundant following major structural changes in world trade patterns due to globalisation or financial crisis and help them find new jobs. Redundant workers are offered measures such as support for business creation, job search assistance, vocational guidance and various types of training. In most cases, national authorities have already begun to take steps to obtain their costs reimbursed by the EU when their applications are approved. The Irish authorities have submitted an application for redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland LTD and two suppliercompanies in Ireland asking for a financial contribution of EUR 2 490 758 to be mobilised. I voted in favour.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: In writing. I voted positively, because it is above all, even if the absolute free-trade policy of the European Union is at the root of the difficulties of European companies, to support a company in difficulty, its managers and its employees.

name: Raffaele FITTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this request to mobilise the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund to provide additional support to Irish Lufthansa Technik workers who have been affected by major changes in the structure of world trade.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 The economic and financial crisis has also hit the Irsk labour market to a significant extent, resulting in the closure of Lufthansa Technik and the shift of global aircraft production. The Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to provide the necessary and necessary support for workers affected by major structural changes in the world trade sector. On 6 February 2015, the European Commission adopted a proposal to mobilise the Fund in favour of Ireland. EUR 2 490 758 from the Resources of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund is to be used for the reintegration of 149 staff. The European Union has significantly changed the way we trade in goods and services in this sector because of the technological transition to the production of next-generation aircraft and components. The funds in question from the Fund are intended to re-engage unemployed workers in the form of job counselling, profiling and vocational training.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 I am voting in favour of granting the fund EUR 2 490 758 for 424 redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland and two of its suppliers.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 The money from the Adjustment Fund should be given primarily to the dismissed and not to reintegration or retraining companies. We do not need skilled unemployed people and that is why I am voting against the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund: application EGF/2014/016 IE/Lufthansa Technik.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 On 6 February 2015, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to use the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for Ireland to support the reintegration into the labour market of workers made redundant as a result of major structural changes in world trade. The request was sent to the Commission on 19 September 2014. The Commission concludes that the request exhausts the necessary exceptional circumstances. The Irish authorities argue that the wave of redundancies at LTAI is primarily the result of major changes in the EU's trade in goods and services, which in turn is the result of a technological turnaround towards the production of next-generation aircraft and components; the change in the practice of the wider production of aircraft parts is a consequence of the change in the location of global aircraft production, together with the impact on the fundamental market factors of the business model on which ltai is based.  A coordinated package of personalised services to be financed includes career guidance and career planning, EGF training support, training and further education programmes, higher education programmes, business/self-employment grants and income support, including the EGF course contribution scheme. The Fidesz-KDNP delegation supports the motion in the spirit of solidarity. It is important that redundant workers are adequately supported to re-enter the labour market.

name: Eider GARDIAZABAL RUBIAL
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this report because with its approval the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF) will be mobilised to provide an amount of EUR 2 490 758 in commitment and payment appropriations in connection with a request for the mobilisation of the EGF following the 250 redundancies in Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd and two of its suppliers in Ireland.

name: Elisabetta GARDINI
text: in writing. \u2012 As in the case of the vote in support of Greek workers, here too I believe that the request for the use of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund, in accordance with point 13 of the Interinstitutional Agreement of 2 December 2013 between the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission on budgetary discipline, budgetary cooperation and sound financial management , is widely justified and justified.  This is funding requested by the Irish Government in a sector, that of "repair and installation of machinery and equipment" which has seen a 52% reduction in total employment according to the Irish authorities. The funds will be used to help redundant workers find new jobs and to enhance their skills. For these reasons, I have given a favourable opinion.

name: Enrico GASBARRA
text: in writing. Mr Negrescu is presenting us with an important report, for which I would like to stress my support: the use of the Globalisation Adjustment Fund is an extremely important instrument for expressing a sign of closeness to families, workers and businesses.  Ireland's application for Lufthansa Technik involves almost 450 workers; I therefore think it is important to express a rapid and concrete response that can rebuild confidence and recreate employment skills.  Redundancies in the repair and installation of machinery and equipment, particularly in the Southern and Eastern region of Ireland, are undoubtedly linked to major changes in the structure of world trade due to globalisation. Europe must act, in accordance with its international commitments and its role as a global trading player, to adapt its competitive capacity and to relaunch a genuine continental industrial plan. With the Investment Plan, Europe has embarked on a new path; I hope that we will now make bold choices with a great productive and employment impact.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report on resource mobilization for adaptation to a globalized space. The report deals with a item for the reintegration into the labour market of 250 workers in Ireland and the economic benefits that this budgetary mobilisation will have for the region.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report, which refers to the Commission’s proposal for a decision on the mobilisation of the EGF in favour of Ireland to support the reintegration into the labour market of workers made redundant due to major structural changes in world trade patterns due to globalisation. In order to mobilise the Fund, the Commission has submitted to the Budget Authority a transfer request. I voted in favour of this report as I support the idea of providing additional assistance to workers suffering from major structural changes in world trade patterns, when needed. The UK has never made an application under this Fund. UK workers therefore receive none of this support.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour, because the purpose of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund is to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. The closure of the Lufthansa plant was the result of a serious shift in EU trade in goods and services resulting from a technological shift towards the production of new generation aircraft and components. The closure of the plant has had a serious impact on employment and the local and regional economy. I therefore agree with the Commission and rapporteur that due to the exceptional circumstances put forward by the Irish authorities, Ireland is entitled to get a financial contribution from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund.

name: György HÖLVÉNYI
text: Writing. \u2012 On 6 February 2015, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to use the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for Ireland to support the reintegration into the labour market of workers made redundant as a result of major structural changes in world trade. The request was sent to the Commission on 19 September 2014. The Commission concludes that the request exhausts the necessary exceptional circumstances. The Irish authorities argue that the wave of redundancies at LTAI is primarily the result of major changes in the EU's trade in goods and services, which in turn is the result of a technological turnaround towards the production of next-generation aircraft and components; the change in the practice of the wider production of aircraft parts is a consequence of the change in the location of global aircraft production, together with the impact on the fundamental market factors of the business model on which ltai is based.  A coordinated package of personalised services to be financed includes career guidance and career planning, EGF training support, training and further education programmes, higher education programmes, business/self-employment grants and income support, including the EGF course contribution scheme. The Fidesz-KDNP delegation supports the motion in the spirit of solidarity. It is important that redundant workers are adequately supported to re-enter the labour market.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report on resource mobilization for adaptation to a globalized space. The report deals with a item for the reintegration into the labour market of 250 workers in Ireland and the economic benefits that this budgetary mobilisation will have for the region.

name: Carlos ITURGAIZ
text: in writing. U2012 Vote for.  The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional assistance to workers suffering the consequences of major structural changes in global trade patterns. In assessing the application submitted, I consider that it should be granted.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for a proposal for a Resolution from the European Parliament on the proposal for a Decision by Parliament and the Council to mobilise the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for 424 redundancy workers from Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd and two suppliers, as these redundancies have a significant impact on the local and regional economy in the disadvantaged region of Southern and Eastern Ireland. The structural changes affected by the 'Repair and installation of machinery and equipment' sector require concrete measures given the fact that workers in the sector have specific skills that are not easy to use in other sectors.  I therefore support the financial contribution of the EGF, which is intended to mitigate the consequences of redundancies and aims to return workers to the labour market as fast as possible.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. I supported the resolution on Ireland's request to mobilise the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund following redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd. The Fund was created to promote the reintegration into the labour market of workers who are victims of changes in the structure of international trade resulting from globalization, or the financial crisis. I also welcome the adoption of this aid amounting to EUR 2,490,758.

name: Eva KAILI
text: S&D), in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour, because I believe that additional support should be given to workers suffering the consequences of major structural changes in the shape of world trade and should be supported with a view to their reintegration into the labour market if they have been made redundant as a result of the global financial and economic crisis, as is the case with Lufthansa Technik workers.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. Ireland applied for assistance from the EGF after 424 employees at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd. and two suppliers were terminated as a result of growing international competition in aircraft construction and aircraft component repair. The measures co-financed by the EGF would help 250 employees who had been hardest hit by the dismissal and another 200 young people to find new jobs. Support is provided in the form of career guidance and career planning assistance, support for business start-ups and start-up sanitising, training, training and higher education programmes, training grants and income support. I am voting in favour of this motion.

name: Seán KELLY
text: in writing. ‒ I am pleased to support the application for the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund made by Lufthansa Technik Ireland LTD. The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional assistance to workers who have lost their jobs as a result of major structural changes in world trade patterns. Lufthansa Technik was a major employer in Rathcoole, Co. Dublin, and the 250 redundancies which have resulted from its closure have had a significant adverse impact on the local economy. I very much welcome this EUR 2.5m investment by the EU, which will be used to help start new businesses, provide career planning assistance, training opportunities and further education programmes for the former workers, as well as up to 200 young people in the area who are not in employment or education. This is a good example of the practical support the European Union can offer those hardest hit by the economic crisis, in particular young people, and help revive the local economy.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of mobilisation of the Fund, as I support giving assistance to reintegrate workers into the labour market made redundant due to major structural changes in world trade patterns due to globalisation and the economic crisis.

name: Jérôme LAVRILLEUX
text: In writing. After having already voted in the Committee on Employment and Social Affairs, I have renewed my vote in favour of the Negrescu report, which will finance 60% of the Projects under the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund to promote the reintegration of 148 former employees of the Irish company Lufthansa Technik. EUR 2,490,758 will be spent on career guidance and planning aids and training and advanced education programmes. These measures are proving to be an effective lever to combat mass unemployment in the Union and to deal with the sometimes harmful consequences of globalisation.

name: Constance LE GRIP
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the Negrescu report to allocate nearly EUR 2.5 million under the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EMF) to finance measures to reintegrate 148 laid-off employees of the Irish company Lufthansa Technik. Through the adoption of the Negrescu report, the mobilization of the EGF will enable concrete assistance to former Lufthansa Technik employees, demonstrating once again the European Union's ability to respond effectively to major structural changes in international trade as a result of globalisation, or the global economic and financial crisis.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. Ireland filed application EGF/2014/016 IE/Lufthansa Technik for financial contribution from FEAG following a total of 424 redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd (LTAI) and two of its suppliers in Ireland. Workers in this sector have very specific skills, difficult to use in other sectors, so it is not easy for them to find a new job. The importance of improving the employment prospects of all workers through adapted training measures and the recognition of skills and skills acquired throughout the worker's professional career should therefore be recalled. Vote in favour of this motion for a resolution and I hope that the training offered in the coordinated package will not only be tailored to the needs of laid-off workers, but also to the current business environment.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. ‒ Last month, the European Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to mobilise the €2.5 million European Globalisation Adjustment Fund to help Irish citizens fired from Lufthansa Technik. Irish authorities argue that the closure of Lufthansa Technik is conditional on changes in world trade, technological change and the production of new generations of aircraft whose drivers are countries such as India and China. Thus, the parent company, Lufthansa Technik from Germany, decided to move its facilities to countries where the workforce is cheaper and the more innovative and faster development of aviation technology. The number of employees in this sector in Ireland is currently only 1550 people, or 52% less than before these changes.  The EGF funds will be used to co-finance the personalised assistance package of 424 redundant workers. They need help finding a new job, and for training and training or encouraging self-employment.  The skills and knowledge of people employed in this sector are specific and find it more difficult to find a job because the same skills are not needed in other sectors. In view of this, I support the request to mobilise the EGF for former workers of the Irish subsidiary of Lufthansa Technik.

name: Vladimír MAŇKA
text: Writing. \u2012 The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund is primarily aimed at supporting and assisting in cases where, as a result of major structural changes caused by globalisation and the global financial and economic crisis, a large number of employees have been made redundant during the reference period, at least 500.  This is the second application since the beginning of 2015, when this condition is not met, although there are other exceptional circumstances linked to the economic impact, as employment in the aircraft manufacturing sector has fallen by 52% in Ireland. A serious fact is that there are also 200 young people under the age of 25 who do not have sufficient education. Rather, the aid will enable them to find a place in the labour market.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting in favour of the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund; in accordance with point 13 of the Interinstitutional Agreement of 2 December 2013 between the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission on budgetary discipline, cooperation in budgetary matters and sound financial management, since the Irish authorities decided to launch the implementation of personalised services to affected workers on 7 December 2013 , long before the decision and indeed from the request for EGF support for the proposed coordinated package.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. ‒ By way of an explanation of my vote, I considered this to be an appropriate cause for mobilisation of the EGF.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the Commission proposal concerning the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund in support of Ireland totalling EUR 2 490 758. I think it is appropriate to mobilise the EGF as a valuable aid for the reintegration into the labour market of the 149 redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland LTD. It is necessary for the European Union to act promptly in support of its citizens and entrepreneurs affected by the crisis

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. \u2012 Due to significant changes in the structure of world trade, attributable to the advance of globalisation, the economic sector "repair and installation of machinery and equipment", in Ireland, has suffered a sharp contraction. Aware of this reality, I have chosen to vote in favour of the Negrescu report, which supports the mobilisation of the EGF for the benefit of 424 workers made redundant at Lufthansa Technik. The Community contribution will help to ensure that they are more easily reintegrated into the labour market.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. My support for the proposal to mobilize the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund to support Ireland in the firing of 424 Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd and two of its suppliers is being mobilized. In this case, Ireland will not only support these workers with European funds, but also 200 young people who neither study nor work. From the European Parliament, we hope that the aid provided through this tool will allow all these people to return to the labour market soon.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland (LTAI) was closed due to the serious shift in the trade in goods and services in the Union, a shift in the general practice of the manufacture of aircraft components and a geographical shift in global aircraft production. As a result, many workers have been made redundant. These workers who have become unemployed as a a body as a a cost of structural change must, of course, receive support, which is why I voted positively in favour of this motion.

name: Valentinas MAZURONIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of supporting the retraining and return of the people of ireland's southern and eastern regions to the labour market after the closure of the aircraft and component production company LTAI and the relocation of its parent company Lufthansa Technik to Asian countries resulted in a significant number of rediciancies and an unemployment rate in the region reaching 23%. Support shall be granted from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for occupational reorientation of the unemployed, career planning measures and further education programmes.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. This globalization aid fund plays its destructive role. Instead of helping workers, it encourages shareholders and states to adhere to the social irresponsibility of capitalism. In this case, one of Lufthansa's subsidiaries specializing in aircraft equipment leaves nearly 500 employees stranded in parts of Ireland where employment opportunities are almost non-existent. Meanwhile, the parent company of this German company is quietly relocating part of its business to the Philippines. Nothing is being done to prevent this social dumping by our own European companies. The report does not even condemn the practice of the company, nor does it question European industrial policy. We know where the unbridled pursuit of cost reductions leads. Germany should think about it. I am voting against it to denounce the European Union's relocation aid.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. \u2012 The EU is an area of solidarity and includes the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund. This support is essential to help the unemployed and the victims of relocations in a globalised context. More and more companies are relocating, taking advantage of the low labour prices that are practised in several countries, notably China and India, with harmful effects on countries that respect workers' rights. The EGF is intended to help workers who are victims of business relocation, and is key to facilitating access to new employment. The EGF has already been used in the past by other EU countries and is now responsible for giving this aid to Ireland, which has submitted the EGF/2014/016 IE/Lufthansa Technik application to a financial contribution from the EGF following 424 redundancies at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd (LTAI) and two of its suppliers in Ireland.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF) is one of the key tools in the EU’s arsenal to provide additional assistance to workers negatively impacted by major structural changes in world trade patterns. The Commission approved this specific application as it met the conditions to mobilise the EGF to support the local economy. I therefore voted in favour of this report to alleviate the situation of 250 workers and 200 young people in Ireland due to a shift towards a new generation of aircraft and components.

name: Giulia MOI
text: in writing. \u2012 We are voting in favour of granting funding to 250 workers made redundant in the south-east of Ireland. The funds will also be used to provide placement services for some 200 young people who are unemployed and not enrolled in training or education courses under the age of twenty-five.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund is an important institution of solidarity within the Union; an active employment policy instrument that shares the burden of returning to the labour market between the worker, the Member State concerned and the Union, and its results help both the worker who is able to re-enter the labour market, the Member State that is forced to deal with unemployment and the Union which is aiming to increase employment. The application submitted by Ireland requires assistance for a personalised service for the reintegration of 149 workers made redundant between 1 March and 30 June 2014. According to the Commission's position, the application meets the eligibility criteria set out in the Regulation and the provision of the service started well before the application was submitted. On the basis of all this, I found the application worthy of support.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 Regulation (EC) No 1927/2006 of the European Parliament and the Council of 20 December 2006 established the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF) with the aim of supporting workers who have lost their jobs due to structural changes in the context of the global economy. This is the tenth application to be examined under the 2015 budget and refers to mobilising a total amount of €2,490,758 from the EGF in favour of Ireland. The Irish authorities argue that the closure of ltai is the result of a profound change in trade in goods and services in the EU resulting from a technological change in the production of new generation aircraft and their components. The application thus concerns the dismissal of 149 persons in the reference period between 1 March 2014 and 30 June 2014. I am therefore in favour of this report which aims to mobilise an important financial sum to support people who have lost their jobs by enabling them to re-train their vocational guidance, so that they have new tools and better skills to return to the labour market.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. This request relates to the granting of assistance to the aviation sector in Ireland following the dismissal of 424 employees at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd and two of its suppliers, which could have a "serious impact on the employment and economy of the region".  Without public aid, these redundancies could have dramatic economic and social consequences for the region given the specific skills of the workers concerned. However, a special scheme is requested by the Committee on Budgets: aid will not be granted to all laid-off workers, but will be assessed on a case-by-case basis to ensure that the condition of "serious impact on the regional economy" is met. It will be mobilised an amount of 2,490,758 euros in commitment credits, to help reorientation, the creation of businesses and the training of NEETs (young people without jobs or training).  These layoffs are due to changes in the structures of the economy caused by globalization and the relocation of aircraft production. This testifies to the hypocritical behaviour of the European Union, which deplores the consequences of the causes it cherishes, namely globalised and deregulated competition, and which finds, to repair them, only the obole to bring to the laid-off workers... I voted for it.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report on the mobilization of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund. The aim is to mobilise the Fund to the tune of 2.5 million euros to support the reclassification of 149 employees laid off by Lufthansa Technik and two of its suppliers in Ireland. These layoffs follow changes in the configuration of the global aviation maintenance market (renewal of the engine of air fleets and competition from low-cost emerging countries).

name: Alessia Maria MOSCA
text: in writing. \u2012 We welcome the call for mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for Ireland in order to support the reintegration into the labour market of lufthansa technik workers, who have been made redundant as a result of major changes in the structure of world trade.  On the basis of the data cited by the Irish authorities, the closure of LTAI is a direct consequence of a major change in trade in EU goods and services, resulting from a technological migration to the production of new generation aircraft and components, from the switch to larger-scale methods in their production, with consequent repercussions on the market fundamentals of the business model on which LTAI relied. , and finally from the geographical transfer of world production.  The coordinated package of personalised services to be cofinanced will be directed mainly at vocational guidance and career planning actions, training and refresher programmes, higher education programmes, through the payment of the costs of participation in the relevant courses. We are therefore sure that these European incentives will be a valuable aid for the reintegration of these workers.

name: Alessandra MUSSOLINI
text: in writing. \u2012 This report refers to the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF) totalling EUR 2 490 758 for Ireland. Specifically, the application concerns 149 redundancies, in the reference period from 1 March 2014 to 30 June 2014, at Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd (LTAI) and two of its Irish suppliers.  In the light of the above, I voted in favour of the Negrescu report because I believe that workers, victims of the economic and financial crisis and market imbalances attributable to the progress of globalisation, must have full support from the European Union. The amount allocated will help to provide them with new employment opportunities.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted for the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund, the request of EGF/2014/016 IE/Lufthansa Technik, as rapporteur for this application and as special rapporteur of the S&D Group for the EGF. The application is well documented and complies with the requirements of the European Commission in this area.

name: Liadh NÍ RIADA
text: scríofa. ‒ Chaith mé vóta i bhfabhar na tuarascála seo de bharr go n-aithním go bhfuil an Ciste Eorpach um Choigeartú don Domhandú (CED) ábalta cabhair agus deiseanna a thabhairt dóibh siúd atá tar éis a bpost a chailliúint mar gheall ar an ngéarchéim eacnamaíochta. Is cás Éireannach é seo agus baineann sé le 250 iomarcaíocht ó Lufthansa Technik agus 200 duine óg atá dífhostaithe. Tá tionchar ollmhór ag dúnadh an chomhlachta seo ar an gceantar áitiúil i mBaile Átha Cliath, agus cinnte, níos faide ná sin fós. Bhí sé lonnaithe in áit atá faoi mhíbhuntáiste le leibhéal íseal de gnóthachtáil oideachasúil srl. Mar aon leis sin, tá scileanna faoi leith ag na daoine seo a chiallaíonn go mbeidh sé deacair dóibh post eile a aimsiú in earnáil dhifriúil.  Leis an aistriú airgid de EUR 2 490 758 áfach, beidh na daoine atá fágtha gan fostaíocht anois ábalta scileanna nua a fhoghlaim, rud a chiallaíonn go mbeidh sé níos fusa dóibh post eile a aimsiú in earnáil éagsúil.  De ghnáth bíonn 500 duine ar a laghad de dhíth chun iarratas a dhéanamh chuig CED, mar sin cuirim fáilte roimh an tslí gur cuireadh maolú i bhfeidhm ionas go mbeidh teacht ag na daoine ar an gciste seo.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional support to workers suffering the consequences of the economic crisis. The redundancies affected 424 workers – the Lufthansa Technik Airmotive Ireland Ltd division and two suppliers.
